title: Chile's Atacama Desert is a graveyard for the world's junk - and it is threatening science
description: Chile's Atacama Desert is being threatened by piles of trash dumped there from around the world, which is also damaging scientific research. This area is key to helping find life on other planets.

title: Humans and octopuses descended from SAME animal that lived 518 million years ago
description: Octopuses have a large variety of gene regulators in their bran that is similar to the human brain. Experts say it is because they both descended from the same primitive worm-like animal.

title: Video captures the moon photobombing the sun
description: The video was taken by a satellite observing the outer surface of the sun when the moon moved by. It shrouded the sun in a a dark silhouette, and as the lunar orb disappeared, a filament erupted.

title: Food poisoning outbreak linked to oysters: FDA warns Americans in 13 states

title: Flu-turistic: Scientists create super-influenza vaccine that can fight 20 strains

title: Covid-like virus is discovered lurking in bats in southern China
description: The virus, known as BtSY2, is one of five found in bats in China's Yunnan province 'that are likely to be pathogenic to humans or livestock', say experts.

title: Study reveals Britain's greenest areas, with Exeter, Islington and Bristol topping the list

title: Fossil of 8ft-long ichthyosaurus preserved for 180 million years tipped to sell for over £500,000

title: Ancient coin depicting a Hanukkah story villain is found in a suspected thief's home in Israel
description: The coin, dating  between 169 and 164 BC, was minted by the ancient Greek king Antiochus IV and was among a trove of artifacts recovered at the home of a man charged with illegal looting.

title: Scientists create a wheelchair that can be controlled with your MIND
description: Patients wearing a cap of  electrodes can drive a wheelchair using just their minds. The electrodes send brain signals to a laptop on the back of the chair so AI can translate them into movements.

title: Raunchy lyrics encourage sexting in teen boys, study finds

title: NASA's Orion spacecraft snaps a stunning photo of the moon during its lunar fly-by
description: As part of the Artemis I mission, the Orion module was required to circle the moon in order to help it place itself into its orbit later this week. Just before it did so, it took a photo of our natural satellite.

title: 'Leap second' will be scrapped by 2035, as it could wreak havoc on GPS and telecoms
description: Scientists at the General Conference on Weights and Measures have ruled to scrap the leap second, which keeps astronomical time in sync with atomic clocks and Coordinated Universal Time.

title: Former Google engineer blames the internet's failures for why search has had an 'overall decline'

title: Remains of 'America's first veterans' who died in the Revolutionary War are found in South Carolina
description: Human remains belonging to American soldiers who died during the 1780 Battle of Camden have been found. These men are deemed heroes, as many of their fellow men fled - but they stayed to fight.

title: TikTok slashes revenue targets by $2BN amid global online advertising slump hitting tech firms
description: TikTok slashed its revenue target for this year by $2 billion as the popular video-sharing app is dealing with the same global online advertising slump that's impacting all major tech firms.

title: US Army tests DRONES to deliver blood and medical supplies in dangerous battlefield situations

title: Chip designed to mimic a human placenta and embryo could replace drug testing pregnant mice
description: A breakthrough chip with human placenta and embryo cells could replaces drug safety testing on pregnant mice. Scientists said these animals are not accurate for testing such drugs.

title:
NASA starts 'new chapter in astronomy' with image of a galaxy that formed 350M years after 
Big Bang
description: A new James Webb Telescope picture shows a tiny orange speck in the distance that is the farthest starlight ever seen by human eyes. It formed just 350 million years after the Big Bang.

title: NASA's James Webb captures once-hidden beginnings of a young star that is only 100,000 years old

title: Twitter will ditch the 280 character limit and allow longer tweets 'soon', says Elon Musk

title: Brown bears are mating with polar bears and creating a more climate resilient hybrid animal
description: Polar bears and brown bears are thought to be mating in Russia due to rising temperatures depleting sea ice and forcing the Arctic species to venture inland to hunt, where they meet grizzlies.

title: NASA's Orion snaps a stunning 'blue marble' image of Earth as it heads to the moon

description: A nonprofit organization has spent the last two years cleaning up human trash around a World Heritage site located in Hawaii, which is home to 7,000 species - and many are endangered.

title: NASA shares footage of Earth taken from the Orion spacecraft during its launch

title: Moment a 'snake' slithers across the sun's surface at 380,000 MPH is captured by ESA's Solar Orbiter
description: The 'snake' feature is actually a tube of cool atmospheric gasses making its way through the sun's magnetic field. The video is sped up and it took around three hours to complete its journey.

title: Woman who died at the age 65 in Norway during the Middle Ages is brought back to life in a 3D model
description: The model, named Tora, was created using the bones of a 13th century woman who died at the age of 65 in Norway. Experts say she must've had access to nutritional food to live so long.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX buys ad campaign on Twitter for Starlink as advertiser exodus accelerates
